q: Observer, Justin Webb assesses the memoirs of "a man who, in his pomp, was a political warrior without peer". There is little contrition, as Donald Rumsfeld offers a "defence of GuantÃ¡namo" which is compelling, at least as a counterweight to what in Britain has become a well-entrenched narrative that the prison was and is a disaster.
